website_summaries.verdict: The Manta Ray locks into place on your bar, so it won't pop off like many round foam pads.
pros: Takes the stress off your deltoids and vertebrae, and transfers it across your trapezius to reduce risk of injury
Snaps into bar to keep it centered on every set
Provides a stronger connection than foam barbell pad
Makes the bar very stable on your back
cons: Will not fit an EZ Bar
Takes time to get used to the feeling on your back

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING BEATS THE REAL THING
customer_reviews.text: What a difference between the real thing and a knock off. This one snaps into place like it is supposed to and stays in place. Very comfortable and allows you to focus on doing a proper squat instead of the pain across your shoulder blades. The plastic is stiff by still pliable. The extra price is worth the ease of use and the quality of workmanship over the other brands. Wish I had another as this gets borrowed in the gym a lot..
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Swanson

customer_reviews.title: THE best bar support for your neck
customer_reviews.text: At any price this is the best accessory you can buy for exercises that require the bar to rest on your spine/neck. I started experiencing numbness in my arms while doing squats, even while using a standard bar pad because the weight was compressing my spine. I worked out with my friend who had a manta ray, and I didn't experience any numbness or pain. I've had this for almost a year and out allows me to focus on the workout movement instead of trying to hurry because the bar is hurting my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT THAT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I know there are some reviews that say this pushes on their spine, shoulders or neck. I use this regularly and don't have that same problem until I go with heavy weights which it doesn't matter what you use will put all that pressure in those areas. I have fixed that by using a small hand towel and folding it in half and placing it between the Manta and my neck/shoulders. That works for me and the towels doubles as a sweat rag.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Hunter Killer

customer_reviews.title: Doctor's review: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal, can't live without this. Let me say I'm a spine doctor and I highly recommend this to all my weight lifting patients as healthy for their neck and back. Keeps the weight off pain sensitive structures in the neck and upper back, and also forces good form in the entire spine and body.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is stiffer than in previous models
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Manta Ray in the past. The product is not as good as previously. First, when attaching to a bar, you really have to push it into place, whereas before it was much easier to attach. Second, the plastic is much more rigid and stiff than in previous models. This places a strain on one's neck, which is part of what we are looking to avoid with this apparatus in the first place! I found very little difference between the new Manta Ray and just using the bar. I have returned to using a foam roller on the bar instead.
customer_reviews.author: TampaPete

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to do squats or lunges don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Used one of these for the first time in high school 10+ years ago and it was amazing. I always told my friends that lift about it. I was amazed when I found it on amazon. Immediately made the purchase. This product is a must have! Especially if you squat a bunch of weight. It will prevent squat knots, it also distributes the weight evenly on your shoulders. I have been using this to teach people how to have good form while performing squats. This product makes it extremely easy to focus on keeping your back straight no matter how much weight you have on the bar because it’s being stabilized for you. I love the Manta Ray!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for squatting
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know such a product existed and was complaining to my husband about how I hated doing back squats because the bar hurt my neck. He said to try this out and it has made a huge difference. It distributes the weight more evenly and doesn’t hurt my neck at all. Love it and highly recommend for anyone that likes to do back squats.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica File

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but....
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Amazing how it displaces the weight so that it doesn't hurt your traps. I thought I wouldn't be able to get used to the pain, but I was wrong. I did eventually get used to it to the point where it no longer hurts to have the bar on my traps. So, I ended up giving it to my brother. He loves it. I no longer need it. A caveat. It places the bar higher on your shoulders then it normally would if not using it. It will feel strange and does take getting used to. Also, you will not be able to squat as much as you're used to with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Naes Nelom

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like it put the weight in a weird spot and hurt my back first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: but a good compromise. The bar sits on a bad spot ...
customer_reviews.text: We are all built different. would I mold one to me if possible yes, but a good compromise. The bar sits on a bad spot for me doing squats. By using this Manta Ray I am at least able to do squats where I couldn't before do to upper back injury. Made of plastic and is stiff and slick. Choose shirt wisely underneath as may slip down while in use. Little sweat will cure the slickness...too much sweat will also have slippery effect.
customer_reviews.author: -JT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. I have extensive nerve damage in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I have extensive nerve damage in the c7 part of my spine due to jumping the bar when it pinches me from being in the wrong spot. From over 25 years of squatting. I cant squat 1 plate for it numbs out my neck but with the manta ray I can squat 5 plates and a quarter and not feel the bar on my back. Wish I would have known of this product when I started. it takes getting used to. Uncomfortable at first but when you break it in its awesome. You wont want to squat without it. Highly recommend it............
customer_reviews.author: george t.

customer_reviews.title: works well for free-weight bar (doesn't work in Smith-machine)
customer_reviews.text: This device works well when attached to a free bar weight, as shown. I find it distributes the weight better on my shoulders, and produces less strain. HOWEVER, it does not work when attached to the weight bar of my Smith-machine, because the weight bar hooks must be rotated in and out of the frame, and the Manta doesn't really allow for rotation, once attached to the bar.
customer_reviews.author: C. Delmar

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product
customer_reviews.text: if you have never use this before I HIGHLY recommend that you do, it is a night and day difference. I used this all throughout high-school and college and this is something I always have in my gym bag. I have one in my car just incase I forget mine at home.
customer_reviews.author: Walt-Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Makes squats more comfortable on your traps
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic. Easy to snap on to a bar for squats at the gym. Much more comfortable that using the bare bar or using one of the questionable cushions at the gym tha probably have never been washed.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent
customer_reviews.text: Quality piece of exercise equipment! Used one at my old gym (frequently went missing). I knew sooner later I would own one. If you value good form and balance while squatting, accept no substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Joint complex

customer_reviews.title: Worth it...
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once so far, so much more comfortable to do squats using it, did not get any more neck/back pain at all. I did feel very weird using it though, I would feel unbalanced and could not bend legs as much as I would on past squats. It would take a few times to settle and not get any discomfort at neck/shoulder areas. I am sure I will get back to great squats as before and even better form in a few weeks after using it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Corona

customer_reviews.title: High quality... worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This my second manta ray. I had one years ago and somehow lost it. When I started lifting again I forgot how painful a weighted bar across the shoulders and back of the neck could be. So I bought the manta ray again... I'm sure I'll find the old one now. But bottom line I liked it enough to buy it again. I saw other "knock off" versions but they didn't look the same and I knew the original was of high quality. A little more costly, but when it comes to protecting myself from pain and potential injury it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: r.drew

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Seems expensive at first, but it's worth the cost. It's heavy duty plastic designed to last a life time. Squats are not painful on the neck, and it seems to improve form and consistency when lifting. Great if you don't want excess pain on the neck or if you have a medical issue around the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Clay R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fits 1.25 thick barbell!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could squat again as I have had some rotator cuff issues for awhile. I was pleasantly surprised that it gives you a more comfortable position so you don't have bring your arms all the way back like a normal squat position. It does make the barbell sit higher though and you have to be more upright when squatting. Another plus is that it fits my barbell of 1.25" thickness. Just give it a good punch to fit it in place. Very useful and simple equipment I should have bought years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: No more bone pain
customer_reviews.text: I’m a skinny person and the bar hurts my shoulder and neck. I had bought a foam pad to remedy this but it was bulky and put my neck too forward. This actually distributed the weight and alleviated the pain.
customer_reviews.author: ndrwum

customer_reviews.title: expensive and does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I have more bone than muscle on my shoulders as a beginner weightlifter, and this does a great job of keeping the bar from gouging your neck and shoulders. $50 is a lot for a piece of molded plastic, but it's worth it to me. I have tried foam pipe insulation - not the same comfort or felling of stability at all.
customer_reviews.author: robert bleidt - streaming media executive

customer_reviews.title: It's ok..
customer_reviews.text: Just be tough and grow some traps and you wont need this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: If holding the bar on your back is uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Serves it purpose. When squatting large weight it helps to keep the bar from digging into my shoulder. Some people complain that you cant squat with the bar in a lower position, which is true however with my shoulder injury I cant stabilize the bar that far down anyway. Good if having the bar on your back is uncomfortable for you or you have trouble keeping the bar from rolling off. Lets me focus on squat more and less on keep the bar in place on my upper back, I'm trying to work my legs not my ability to withstand a bar digging into my traps.
customer_reviews.author: pulsepb

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Had one in the past and misplaced it. Great device and save your back, neck and traps from the pain of the barbell digging in. Safe and comfortable squatting with the Manta Ray.
customer_reviews.author: Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Used these in high school way back when and decided to buy for myself. Definitely more comfortable than placing a ton of weight directly on your shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was needed!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this addition to his gym workout gear. The bar helps stabilize his squats and keep his posture as it should be. He’s glad we got it!
customer_reviews.author: JMJ VA

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: I think this device is ridiculously over priced. Does it work? Yes. It causes far less pain on my neck when lifting, but I still think it should be half the price!
customer_reviews.author: Laura E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this if you think you can use with Smith Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work with Smith Machine Squats. Well it does not fit on the bar thus I could not use it. I had one many years ago and it worked this is a bad imitation.
customer_reviews.author: HappyOne

customer_reviews.title: Safety over Bravery
customer_reviews.text: I began squatting years back because I read so much at how squats could help me gain strength and weight however I vowed I would not do this dangerously by hurting my back or I knew the game would be over as I had met others as I worked in Physical therapy who tried perhaps too hard to reach their goals and they were rehabilitating for months before they could begin lifting again. The Manta Ray provides the support I need and I have reached the 450lb mark in squatting which I know is a hefty goal. Never lift more than what is reasonable to work with-SAFETY FIRST-DON'T BE A HERO-REACH YOUR GOALS SAFELY!
customer_reviews.author: PINKY

customer_reviews.title: Comfort while lifting, no sacrifice of form
customer_reviews.text: I use this for squats, and it allows me to focus on form and balance, as opposed to the potential pain of the bar as it rests on my body. It's stood up to decent amounts of weight (for me, a 150 lb male), and is also used by multiple roommates on a regular basis. I've used it for over a year, with no noticeable wear and tear. It fits on the bar perfectly, and will stay on the bar, even when the bar is resting on the pegs for an extended time, removing a need to store it elsewhere, when the bar isn't in use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: If youre used to high bar squatting than this is for you. I squat with the bar lower than this so I ended up going full bar once I bit some traps and strength to hold the bar. When I used the manta ray I had to squat more upright, if I didn't I felt as is I dipped forward. It was too unnatural for ME there fore this product didn't work for ME. I gave it 5 stars for what it is. Know what kind of squatter you are and this will help you on your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jovany A Perez

customer_reviews.title: So far...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Still trying to get use to using this product during squats. The weight distribution is different, so getting my body to feel the weight in the proper places is important.
customer_reviews.author: Nylza1

customer_reviews.title: A big 4" foam pool noodle is far superior - And available for 5 bucks at Walmart.
customer_reviews.text: Way, waaaaaaaaay to hard. Wouldn't conform to my traps even after multiple use. For me, it was just to uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Artanis Regnis

customer_reviews.title: It feels great and promotes correct form
customer_reviews.text: It feels great and promotes correct form. It works better if your traps a bit more developed. I had buddies try it who had pretty flat traps and they complained a bit about discomfort. This works perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have the right clavicle width
customer_reviews.text: If you have a fairly narrow clavicle, this would be awesome. i however, do not, so it smashes down on my shoulders and breastplate. I found if I move it further back on my traps and upper back, it is comfortable, but make sure you are ready to support the weight via arm and shoulder strength. it does however help in keeping a more structured and fluid squat with heavier weights. the weight i use now is down due to more emphasis on the quads and hamstrings, and taking the weight off the lower back. it is good though, you just need to find where you are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Makes you love squats even more than you already do!
customer_reviews.text: A gym I went to years ago had one of these and I liked it ... so I bought one for personal use. I'm glad I did. It's a little pricey, but it's nothing compared to the price of a chiropractor visit. If placing a bar on your neck vertebrae seems like a bad idea to you, this will help solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Ok but Velcro pad is better
customer_reviews.text: Great in theory but terrible in practice on a smith machine. I’d line it up then rotate the bar and it’s in the wrong position. Probably works better on a standard fee bar. I found the passing with Velcro worked much better
customer_reviews.author: Jason in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: this is great for those without a trap shelf (such as beginners ...
customer_reviews.text: this is great for those without a trap shelf (such as beginners and or natural female lifters) or for those who need to squat high bar in order to keep a proper bar line to the foot center. I recommend giving a try if you fit these guidelines. I am 6'1" 264lbs and still play with it sometime.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Allen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: What I once considered a highly priced mold of plastic, instantly became a must have. I especially enjoy the standing barbell calf raises using this to stabilize. I also reccomened the front squat version.
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but gotta get used to it
customer_reviews.text: For my 13 and 15 year old sons it works great. It takes the pressure off their shoulders and helps keep good form. I am a larger guy and for me it moves too much on my shoulders. My son says my traps are too big and therefore it rocks around during the squatting movement and makes me feel a little uncomfortable and uneasy. It may grow on me as time goes on but initial impressions is that it may be size dependent. It is constructed really well, nice and solid. I think it will wear nicely over time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Georgiades

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I've been working out for about 15 years now. I've always respected squats for being the best leg exercise, but always dreaded it. I've always had extreme pain in my shoulders from the bar, even with foam. From the first use of the Manta Ray, I knew this would completely change the way I feel about doing squats. I absolutely love it! It makes squats so comfortable and allows me to use more weight than ever before. Considering all the money you spend on supplements or equipment, the manta ray is a no brainer..buy one.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any lifter with a bad shoulder
customer_reviews.text: The Manta Ray is one of the most important items in my gym bag. I injured my shoulder about five years ago and have trouble holding the bar in place when squatting with anything at or near my body weight. This device takes all the pressure off my shoulder and allows me to lift heavy again. It takes some getting used to and does force you to alter your form somewhat because you're shifting the weight higher on your back, but all-in-all it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Take a load off
customer_reviews.text: This was completely unnecessary when I was younger but I won't squat without it now. I had a bar pad that I thought was very good but even with that I was getting compression of my vertebrae with is causing me some problems. This does a much better job of dispersing the load. I'm sure it's not going to fit everyone perfectly but with a little practice it's easy to get used to. I have no complaints. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: 4America

customer_reviews.title: Great Design!
customer_reviews.text: The Manta snaps on the bar and holds firm. It is difficult to slide on the bar so you will want to make sure it is centered when you snap it on. The Manta rests well on my traps, I am not a big guy though 5’8” 170lbs. I have a mild neck injury, and when I do squats with the bar it rest right on the vertebrate that has the issue. I used to hardly be able to do squats even with a towel or pad. A friend told me about the manta and I could not be happier. I will not do squats without it.
customer_reviews.author: goughbadley

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This allows the lifter to spread the weight he/she is trying to squat across the entire upper back instead of the weight resting in a 3x1 area where the bar is. Instead of focusing on the weight on your shoulders, you can concentrate on good form and completing the lift. Very comfortable...extremely durable. Snaps on the bar and stays in position until you take it off after the lift. One word to the wise though: watch this. I've had two magically disappear when I step away. I wouldn't squat without it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: SURPRISING RESULTS
customer_reviews.text: This product worked better than I expected. I thought it would be a little softer, but it works great for my Squats and lunges workout.
customer_reviews.author: FRITZTA

customer_reviews.title: this would have been a great product for me but the bar at my gym ...
customer_reviews.text: this would have been a great product for me but the bar at my gym was too big to fit into the groove. Although i had to send it back just by examining it. This is really sturdy and comfortable when i put it on my shoulders so if you order this you will love it. I wish they had a wider one I would order it for me...!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chocol8drop

customer_reviews.title: The pad sit comfortably across the back of the shoulder and rest over ...
customer_reviews.text: I typically use your standard foam squat pad but found them to be rather uncomfortable. The Manta Ray was a welcomed solution for me. The pad sit comfortably across the back of the shoulder and rest over the collarbone. The pad distributes the weight evenly and encourages correct hand placement. I also found that helps with the lower back as I can concentrate on proper form when lifting
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Manta Ray device and it works very well. I have not tried any other product similar to this one so I can't comment. I prefer this instead of the pad. My first one lasted for about 15yrs and it started to crack in a couple of places, nonetheless it is still very durable, normal wear and tear I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta get used to it
customer_reviews.text: Basically it does what it says...i.e. the bar does not rest on your vetebrae. The problem I have is that it takes some getting used to. The cuff does not conform as well as they make it seem to your shoulders so there is usually quite a bit of fussing and shifting when you have it on to find that 'sweet spot'. When you eventually find it you are good to go but before that it is a bit frustrating. Maybe I just need to get used to it a bit more...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these since they came out. I always had problems with the bulky pads and I could never get used to the bare bar. If you are training for competition, I would not use it because they are not allowed in competition. It completely changes how you squat because of the position of the bar. For bodybuilding or just getting in shape at home or the gym, I highly recommend this. Forces stricter form.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: this device might work better. I bought a thick barbell pad that works ...
customer_reviews.text: It left bruises on my neck and shoulders even through a towel folded over twice. The problem with this device is that it appears that it was molded on a piece of 3 inch pipe. The trapezius muscles that go from your neck to your shoulders normally slant down even with your arms raised. If these muscles were as straight as a pipe, this device might work better. I bought a thick barbell pad that works much better, and I don't have to remove it to do bench presses.
customer_reviews.author: Tat

customer_reviews.title: manta for squatting
customer_reviews.text: I am a 40 y/o power lifter. As my poundages go up >450 lbs, I just cant lift the bar anymores without pain on my neck and shoulders. the gyms' foam wrap isnt enough, even with additional towels as padding. a friend introduced me to the manta, and i ordered one the same day. its allowed me to go up 100 lbs in weights since i focus on lifting and not on my neck and shoulder pain. Price is great, the produce works as advertised. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jimbob1971

customer_reviews.title: This is probably my favorite work out accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite work out accessory. It makes doing squats a lot more efficient and balanced. I like the fact that it keeps the bar from crushing the top of you neck when doing heavier lifts.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Lifting Made Easier, Safer, and Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how people lift without this thing, you certainly wont go back to just using a bar after using it even just once! Easily snapping onto standard straight bars, this collar allows for much more comfortable squats that help you focus on greater form and higher weights. No need to compromise your workout for discomfort. Easy to stow in a gym bag without adding any weight and a welcome sight at any gym. This is a must have for squatters!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Made Manta More Comfy. Glue a cushion beneath.
customer_reviews.text: Bought from Amazon US and had it delivered to China. Tried it on a bar and felt that its definitely worth the trouble. Sits a little hard on the shoulder and center back. Took a piece of blue waist rubberband and glued it beneath for extra cushion. It works even better this time, and if its worn, will stick another on it again. Perhaps thats why the manufacturer won't make it with cushion like that cos it could wear off quickly and may get lots of complaint. Kudos to Manta Ray for making training more comfy. Its easy to find counterfeit here but the made is not the same and may not hold up under heavy stress and use.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Chin

customer_reviews.title: Leg Day Staple
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Manta Ray that I have ordered. The first one that I bought 13 years ago was in perfect shape, but I misplaced it, and had to buy another one. It is a must for leg day, it really takes pressure off of the spine and upper trapezius when squatting.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on imitations
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every penny. It made a huge difference in my squats.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Manta Ray works great, my people at the gym won't do squats without it! It's my second one and got over 10 years of use out of first one. My first one broken an end off after one of the members forgot to remove it before putting bars away. So happens that was the first one put away and other 7 Olympic bars got thrown on top of Manta Ray. So, yes it works great and Amazon had the best price and shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love using this to squat with. Hate having the bar on my back the little pad they have at the gym just isn't very comfortable might as well be using the regular bar
customer_reviews.author: timmy

customer_reviews.title: TOO STIFF
customer_reviews.text: I have used a product like this before, and it was slightly flexible. This was not flexible at all , and gouged into my collar bone painfully. It was useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Great for squats
customer_reviews.text: Fits great and disperses the weight over the shoulders not the neck. A must have product
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Saulnier

customer_reviews.title: Comfort !!!
customer_reviews.text: Less shoulder and trap pain from the weight rubbing against the skin. Make doing squats a lot more pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: michael samuels

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: I seem to have an upper spine that simply does not like having weight loaded on it when doing squats. This has helped for me but it is all hard plastic so it forces your anatomy to its shape. A little pading would help for people with unusual anatomical features.
customer_reviews.author: YesIAM

customer_reviews.title: I use this with no problems with old neck injury, just can't use on thicker, newer rack bar as it doesn't fit..
customer_reviews.text: I love this, used it at my old gym but new gym has thicker rack bars and this doesn't fit. I hack a herniated disc in my neck from doing heavy squats 30 years ago....so haven't tried squats until I saw this at my gym. Used it and it distributes the weight, so it's not mainly on neck or spine. I'd go back to my old gym just to be able to use my manta ray for squats, but not with the current owners.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Tucker

customer_reviews.title: I've found the Manta Ray very useful in relieving pressure on my upper spine
customer_reviews.text: I'm nearly seventy but continue to weight train three times a week. I've found the Manta Ray very useful in relieving pressure on my upper spine, thereby making back squats a great deal more comfortable. Because there is less discomfort I find it easier to concentrate on good form in the exercise, and this, in turn, makes injury less likely. I highly recommend the product and I, personally, would not attempt back squats without it. It is well-engineered and sturdily made.
customer_reviews.author: edgarrains

customer_reviews.title: performance and comfort oriented
customer_reviews.text: The Manta Ray is not just a welcome comfort to shouldering the bar but it controls the weight and keeps it where the user wants it balanced. Also very easy to keep clean and durable for multiple lifetimes.
customer_reviews.author: goodnuff2win

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Slightly expensive but I’m glad I bought it. Makes squats much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S.

customer_reviews.title: Improve your technique while lifting heaver weight!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I am at the gym 6 days a week and lift heavy. This allows you to focus on your technique and the weight you're lifting, instead of micro adjustments to keep the bar from crushing the nerves between vertebra.
customer_reviews.author: Greeneeggsandham

customer_reviews.title: Better, Safer Squats
customer_reviews.text: I am remodeling my home. Having the right tool for the job makes projects SO MUCH easier. The Manta Ray is the right tool for squats. I was able to immediately increase my reps and wieghts, due to eliminating the pain on my traps from the bar previously. My form is also better, which means safer squats. My gym (parks and Rec, what can you say) doesn't have these on the Smith Machine, so I bring my own. Everyone checks it out. They know what a pain squats are without one. I'll probably be seeing others bring in their own Manta Rays soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Probably good - just not good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe ok for some people - I returned it because it threw my balance way off, I guess a towel works better for me (or maybe I will buy a foam cover). My advice - see if you can find it local and check out it's positioning on you, it is not flexible in regards to where you can carry the bar to see if its positioning suits your muscular/skeletal type for motion and balance.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.White

customer_reviews.title: You have to stand more erect when doing squats but that is probably a good thing. You have to be careful not to ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets some getting use to, but it works well. Does the job it is suppose to do. You have to stand more erect when doing squats but that is probably a good thing. You have to be careful not to lean forward while doing the squat or the manta will slide forward into the back of your neck.. If you have never done squats you will be able to adapt very easily to this, if you are a veteran squatter you need to retrain yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty in Motion

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for anybody that squats
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, wish I had this sooner. Works better than just a bar pad. More support and the bar feels stable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W.

customer_reviews.title: Finally got my own
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It really helps me to keep the bar stable as I squat. My trainer had one, so I made sure to get one when she left.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I wish I bought this product sooner ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I wish I bought this product sooner in my life. It keeps you in a better position when you squat and takes tension off your neck and shoudlers and I felt the tension more in my squats with better form. I highly recommend anyone into serious squats or better form to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi patel

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Balanced...
customer_reviews.text: Great product for squatting. I used this item last year and it was great to balance the bar and weight on your back. No more of the barbell digging into your spine and distracting you from your squats. Strong plastic material. A suggestion for improvement: Have a removable pad/towel like item to Velcro to the platform that lays on your bad. Other than that a great product that will rev' up your squatting routine!
customer_reviews.author: Afg365

customer_reviews.title: Awesome accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to make working out safer and more comfortable. Squats are a must when working out but I always hated the discomfort of the bar on my shoulders. Well now I dont have to worry about that, and I can focus on my legs and not the stability and discomfort of the bar. To me, this is an essential if you are doing squats.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to...
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had shoulder pain while squatting and since using this product, it has gone away. I find the manta ray places the bar behind my shoulders, right where it is supposed to according to Mark Rippetoe and his explanation from starting strength. It forces you to have proper bar alignment and thus helps to improve form. I've only been using it a week, but it has done exactly what I wanted it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Courtnier

customer_reviews.title: I showed it to a couple of people who were going through their squat routine and they exhibited great interest in it
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Manta Ray, and the first time I used it I noticed the difference. The stress on the neck and shoulders and hips was alleviated and I was able to focus more on completing my squat routine. I showed it to a couple of people who were going through their squat routine and they exhibited great interest in it. It has been two weeks since I purchased the Manta Ray, and I must say that I once again look forward to doing my squat routine. One of the people that I showed it to has already purchased one.
customer_reviews.author: thomas l dozier the word of grace and truth m

customer_reviews.title: A squatter's best friend
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years in the gyms I have been in, and they are amazing. They keep the bar from digging into your back while squatting. My new gym didnt buy any for people to use so I had to get my own. Snap it to the bar, and squat away. It really helps when you get into very heavy weight, 225lbs and above.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Lecompte

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: The Manta Ray is a real necessity in the gym. When I'm doing squats, the lighter weight was never really bad on my neck and shoulders, but the heavier weight would just kill me. I could never really concentrate on the lift and it always left ugly marks on my shoulders. With this, I can really concentrate on my form and I have seen a nice increase in my lifts over time. It is 100% essential and I could not/would not do squats without it again!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: What a novel device! It does a magnificent job ...
customer_reviews.text: What a novel device! It does a magnificent job of distributing the weight of the bar and encouraging proper spine alignment when squatting heavier weights.
customer_reviews.author: David Carn

customer_reviews.title: love it. I am a cert
customer_reviews.text: love it. I am a cert. personal trainer so i use this with clients as well. it takes a lot of focus off of how what or where the bar rest and allows you to stand up straighter without having to worry about falling over or the weight/stress on your shoulders which allows you to use better form during the squat. after some practice you can squat without really using your hands at all.
customer_reviews.author: mike slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Painful squats a thing of the past
customer_reviews.text: This little device is made of hard plastic that snaps onto your bar. Simple, effective, and squats no longer hurt the bones in my neck, letting me focus on the exercise itself. Some other reviewers pointed out that it's "not a good fit" for their body, but the instructions included say to rotate it into a comfortable position, and once you find the sweet spot for you, it's an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Ryniak

customer_reviews.title: Provides comfort when squatting and helps to prevent injury
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this for squat. I have a bad shoulder and use this to stabilize the barbell on my shoulders. When I reach backwards to grip the barbell my shoulder still tightens up a bit, but without this stabilizer gripping the bar would be much more difficult and uncomfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Nelson

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good as long as you have it HIGH on your shoulders. I tend to want bar lower on my back so it doesn't work for me like I'd like but it's still better than bar alone which I did for years with heavy weight. I got tired of red, sore spot on back and callous build-up. It is much more comfortable if you fold up a towel and put under it.
customer_reviews.author: Don-Dallas

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little time to get used to the position of the bar once the Manta Ray is on your shoulders, but the position of the bar forces you to concentrate more on proper form. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Just what we ordered.
customer_reviews.text: My son would get rubbing marks from our free weight bar, but this product eliminates that problem. It is used in their football weight gym in high school so he knew exactly what he needed and it works just great. His Dad wanted him to just duct tape a towel to the bar ("like we used to do in high school"), but this works/looks far better and won't run the risk of slipping.
customer_reviews.author: ecember

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST have
customer_reviews.text: When I received the Manta Ray and opened the box I was shocked how small it was and figured this is going back tomorrow! I decided to give it a try and noticed that it did take the pressure off of my spine when doing squats. With a little experimentation on how it fits on the shoulders (further back than you would think), I now would not sell it for double the money I paid. This is a fantastic product and I reccomend it to everyone!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott G. Meunier

customer_reviews.title: You might have better luck with pipe protecting foam
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for to help correct my form with squats, but my traps hinder me from really enjoying this thing. It takes the pressure off of the spine, but I don't see a difference between this and the bar pad. You might have better luck with pipe protecting foam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing and use it every time I squat ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing and use it every time I squat now! So nice! I am smaller framed though, so it's really nice to have this kind of support. It is slightly pliable and gives a little. Perfect amount of stiffness and bend-ability to help improv my squatting at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Strwberynbanana

customer_reviews.title: Takes away neck pain but watch your back!
customer_reviews.text: The product does an excellent job at protecting you from the painful and pinching sensation of the barbell BUT you MUST get used to the change of balance on your back! I suffered a lower back sprain from squatting only 135 lbs with the Manta ray attached to the barbell.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Scripts R US 2018

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not as malleable and comfortable as these used to be. Digs into my clavicle area. Use a foam pad instead.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Feels good across the back...
customer_reviews.text: I like this, much better than the foam / insulation tubing used in most gyms. More hygienic also. I carry it in my gym bag, with a few other items I like to use at the gym, yet rather not share. Only thing, it doesn't fit all bars. For example the bars on the glide slider racks for squatting.
customer_reviews.author: John Joseph Minardi

customer_reviews.title: Pain Free Squats
customer_reviews.text: This device works very well for me. No pain on my neck or shoulders. I no longer go for heavy squats and work in the 150-250lb range so I cannot say how it would work with heavier weights. For me, it works just fine and eliminates the discomfort of the bar on my spine. I will not do squats without my Manta Ray!
customer_reviews.author: 6 String Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'd seen these before and was curious if they actually worked to relieve the bar pressure. I am slim with a petite build & having the weight bar across my shoulders/neck, even with a bar pad, was uncomfortable. When I used this the first time I was impressed that it actually did what it claimed. I have no shoulder/back or neck discomfort now. It's a great purchase. The only down side is the Mantra Ray is a little big for women my size, so it would be nice if they could make it in a S/M & M/L. I'd recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree' Lowney

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says it will do
customer_reviews.text: Great product if you have had c-spine surgery before, had discomfort from bar in neck spine area after back squats now it distributes across the back and shoulder very little pressure on neck
customer_reviews.author: thomas meigs

customer_reviews.title: Does what it advertises
customer_reviews.text: I like doing Squats. I don't like the way the bare bar sits on my shoulders. Having tried Pads and not liked them much, I looked around and found this product. Its a little pricey but the Manta Ray truly takes the pain out of doing Squats making my workouts more fun and productive. I think that if you really want to do Squats, this product will let you get maximmum benifit.
customer_reviews.author: Tbommy

customer_reviews.title: Make squats easier
customer_reviews.text: This product helps even the load of the bar on your neck , do recommend is you don't like the feeling of the bar on your spine
customer_reviews.author: Danny

product_meta.title: Manta Ray by Advanced Fitness, Squat Load Distribution Device, Barbell Pad Alternative
product_meta.description: This is the original Manta Ray manufactured in the United States by Advanced Fitness. Don't accept any knock-off versions. Made with high-tech, polyurethane polymer, virtually indestructible for years of tough use. You could drive a big truck over the Manta Ray, without doing more than marring the surface. When using the Manta Ray, maintain an upright position when performing barbell back squats.
feature_bullets: Focus on squat movement and technique, not discomfort, numbness or shearing muscle trauma
Load distribution takes the bar off your shoulders and spine, and spreads the weight evenly across your trapezius and torso muscles
Bar no longer presses against your neck, and less shoulder stress when holding the bar
Reduces risks of injuries, protects against crush trauma, maximizes mass-building potential
Easy to use. Snap it into the bar to keep it centered on every set. Provides a stronger connection compared to a typical, foam-based barbell pad
